result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To make reglar monthly payments. Any amount remaining due and owig is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.
*9/30/2015  credit amended to 72 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Complete a pyschological evaluation.  Comply with any recommended treatment.

No drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances without a valid prescrition.  
No association with known drug users or dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Pay all supervision fees, to make regular payments.
AODA assessment.  Satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.  Defendant shall be tested once per month, randomly.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defendant made statements about what he thought the recommendation of the state was.  Case passed to for court to reach reporter.  Case resumed.  Court was not able to reach reporter, and left her a message.  Statements made by defendant stating he now remembers the negotiations and wants to proced with sentencing.  Sentencing proceeds.  Court did receive a call from reporter who informed the court what was stated.

Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS, CONCURRENT with any other sentence, with credit for 95 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- Complete a PSYCHOLOGICAL evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no drug paraphernalia, and no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant shall be tested once per month, randomly.  	
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defendant not produced.  Defendant was in Dodge when an order to produced was done.  Defendant was moved to Racine.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 11/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed by the defense.    Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 3.  Defense counsel will contact this court for new date.  Case set for sentencing on 9-4-14, 8:30 a.m., in Branch 3.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  On motion of the State, court ordered the 'Repeater' penalty enhancer stricken from the charge.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   PSI ordered.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in room 313 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  Final pretrial held.  Filed by the defense:  Proposed Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.  All offers revoked by the State.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6-23-14, 9:00 a.m.
Filed by the State:  Witness List, Motion in Limine, Proposed Jury Instructions.
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received and filed with court
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOPSES OF THE FINAL PRETRIAL AND JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul M Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial Hearing in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING IN BRANC 26.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court (bull pen) with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for Paul M Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 26th for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court, defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin not in court, in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for another scheduling conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Case adjourned to branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jerome Battles-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Derrick Anthony Griffin in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
